These codes were developed by the federal government and are used by the U.S. Office of Management and Budget (OMB) as well as many other U.S. statistical agencies. In 1997, OMB adopted NAICS as its new industry classification system. Every registered Washington firm is assigned a SIC or NAICS code. SIC codes have a hierarchical structure that begins broadly and becomes more specific. 2-digit codes are the broadest while 4, 6, and 8-digit codes become increasingly specific with additional digits. You can easily find broader codes by taking out the first several digits of any SIC code.
